description: Models time-varying volatility using GARCH(1,1) to capture volatility clustering. Provides forward-looking conditional variance estimates that feed into VaR/CVaR tools, risk gating, scenario simulation, and position sizing.
use_cases: Feed volatility forecasts into parametric VaR and Monte Carlo
Trigger regime signals when volatility spikes
Comparative baseline vs hybrid ML/quantum models
Intraday risk estimation with finer granularity

returns.description: Return series (e.g., daily log-returns) for single asset or portfolio
returns.preprocessing: Compute log-returns or simple returns from price series

horizon.description: Number of steps ahead to forecast

q.description: ARCH order for lagged squared returns

alpha.description: Coefficient on lagged squared return (ARCH term)
alpha.interpretation: Impact of recent shocks on volatility

forecasted_variance.description: Forecasted conditional variances for h steps ahead

standard_garch_1_1.variance_equation: sigma_t^2 = omega + alpha * epsilon_{t-1}^2 + beta * sigma_{t-1}^2

variants.name: EGARCH
variants.description: Allows asymmetric impact (negative shocks impact more)

variants.name: GJR-GARCH
variants.use_case: Bad news vs good news differential impact

algorithm_steps.name: prepare_return_series
algorithm_steps.description: Extract return series from price data
preprocessing: Compute residuals if using mean model

algorithm_steps.name: estimate_parameters
algorithm_steps.description: Estimate GARCH parameters via Maximum Likelihood
algorithm_steps.optimization: Maximize L using scipy.optimize or built-in optimizer

algorithm_steps.name: forecast_volatility
algorithm_steps.one_step_ahead: sigma_{T+1}^2 = omega + alpha * epsilon_T^2 + beta * sigma_T^2
algorithm_steps.h_step_ahead: E[sigma_{T+h}^2] = omega * (1 - (alpha + beta)^h) / (1 - (alpha + beta)) + (alpha + beta)^h * sigma_T^2

algorithm_steps.name: pipeline_integration
uses: Feed sigma_t+1 into parametric VaR/Monte Carlo as volatility estimate
Time-adaptive position sizing (scale inversely with forecasted vol)
Trigger regime signals if volatility spikes
Log forecasts, errors vs realized, parameter drift

pseudocode.imports:
from arch import arch_model
import numpy as np
pseudocode.fit_function:
def fit_garch11(returns):
    # returns: 1D numpy array of historic returns
    am = arch_model(returns, vol='Garch', p=1, q=1, mean='Zero')
    res = am.fit(disp='off')
    return res

advantages: Captures volatility clustering / persistence - stylized fact of financial returns
Lightweight and interpretable - fast for daily updates
Works well as volatility baseline in calm-to-moderate markets
Easy to integrate into risk and optimization pipelines
limitations: Assumes symmetric impact of shocks (unless using EGARCH/GJR)
May not capture structural breaks without regime-switching
Does not model intraday patterns without extension
